results.title: Making a pack basket
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: Pop Williams, an old-timer, demonstrates techniques for making a pack basket. He begins with the actual cutting down of an ash tree, stripping it out, and step by step, pounding out the weaving strips, weaving, attaching rims, handles and shoulder straps.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service

results.title: Making a decision in the family
results.creator_credit: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Discussion film for adults on parental authority and teenagers. When a high-school girl declares her preference for going to a gathering of her own friends rather than to a family gathering, she runs headlong into her parent’s objections. It is their decision and not hers which is to abide. The result is a clash of wills. The question of what might have been a better approach is left with the film audience.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Making a car bumper
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description: The making of a steel bumper by a machine press is used to illustrate the skill of the makers of press tools, the punch and the die, by means of which quantities of bumpers can be produced with a minimum of skilled labour. A vocational guidance film showing the skilled work of the tool maker in large-scale production engineering.

results.title: Maitre
results.creator_credit: Jacques Leroux, Manuel Otero, Paris Cite Productions and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: This animated film is an abstract expression of the dilemma of the artist in his search for recognition. The source and process of artistic inspiration are explored as well as the artist’s reactions to his own failure and success. No commentary, music only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques Leroux, Manuel Otero, Paris Cite Productions and Weston Woods Studios

results.title: Magnificent memory
results.creator_credit: R Bacha, Film Group of India and R R D Productions
results.brief_description: The Mogul buildings in Delhi and the Kathak dance of Northern India. The first part of the film studies the architecture of the palaces and forts built by Shah Jehan, the Hall of Audience, the Pearl Mosque and the Red Fort nearby; the second part shows the Kathak dance in this setting.

results.title: The Magic of Walt Disney world
results.creator_credit: Tom Leetch, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Disneyland was the prototype for this larger, more advanced amusement park in Florida. The range of attractions for the tourist are accordingly diverse and spectacular, from the Polynesian Village to the monorail ride and the Fort Wilderness camping ground.

results.title: Magic of the mountains: summer and autumn
results.creator_credit: Mushir Ahmad, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Kashmir, the summer playground of ancient kings and now a holiday resort. Formal Mogul gardens with fountains; flowers; work in papiermache and embroidery; life around the lakes; sports; trips into the mountains; the shepherds; autumn, harvest and fruit picking; the coming of winter.

results.title: The Magic of electricity
results.brief_description: Takes viewer on a tour of Yallourn Power Station, “Victoria’s most important power house”, explaining how electricity is made and distributed within Victoria and Melbourne in particular.

results.title: The Magic bean
results.creator_credit: Terence Weathers, John Ward, Peter Ringsted, Philip Taylor, Thelma Parker and Lyons Visual Aid Unit
results.brief_description: Explains the history of the use of coffee, how it spread throughout the world and the story of its social impact, especially in London in the 17th century, when coffee-houses were the meeting places of artists, scientists and politicians. Information on the coffee bean from plantation to cup is given, and how packing is important to preserve flavour and aroma.

results.title: The Lungs: an inside story
results.brief_description: Uses models and endoscopic photography within a human lung to reveal their structure and workings. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.
